Paradigm.short_description: Fundamental pattern of thought that structures how knowledge is organized.

Episteme.short_description: Historical framework determining what counts as knowledge in an era.

System.short_description: Organized body of ideas forming coherent framework of understanding.

Method.short_description: Fundamental approach to acquiring and validating knowledge.

Logic.short_description: Framework for valid reasoning and inference patterns.

Dialectic.short_description: Process of reaching truth through opposing positions.

Schema.short_description: Organizing structure for categorizing and relating concepts.

Framework.short_description: Basic conceptual structure for organizing theoretical understanding.

Model.short_description: Abstract representation of relationships between phenomena.

Archetype.short_description: Fundamental pattern underlying multiple theoretical expressions.

Discourse.short_description: System of thought defining what can be meaningfully said.

Worldview.short_description: Comprehensive framework for understanding reality and existence.

Ontology.short_description: Framework for understanding nature of being and existence.

Epistemology.short_description: System for understanding nature and limits of knowledge.

Axiology.short_description: Framework for understanding value and evaluation.

Hermeneutics.short_description: System for interpretation and understanding of meaning.

Heuristic.short_description: General approach to problem-solving and discovery.

Metaphysics.short_description: Framework for understanding fundamental nature of reality.

Typology.short_description: System of classification based on fundamental types.

Taxonomy.short_description: Hierarchical system for classifying and relating concepts.

Principle.short_description: Fundamental truth or law governing theoretical understanding.

Doctrine.short_description: Systematic formulation of beliefs or teachings.

Synthesis.short_description: Integration of different theoretical perspectives or elements.

Critique.short_description: Systematic examination of assumptions and limitations.

Analysis.short_description: Method of breaking down complexity into basic elements.

Praxis.short_description: Integration of theory and practice in action.

Dogma.short_description: System of principles considered incontrovertibly true.

Canon.short_description: Standard set of principles or works defining field.

Tradition.short_description: Inherited system of thought and practice.

Ideology.short_description: System of ideas forming basis for theory and action.

Formalism.short_description: System emphasizing formal structures and relations.

Structuralism.short_description: Analysis of underlying patterns and relationships.

Phenomenology.short_description: Study of structures of consciousness and experience.

Teleology.short_description: Understanding in terms of purposes and ends.

Morphology.short_description: Study of forms and patterns of development.

Semiotics.short_description: System for understanding signs and meaning-making.

Metaphor.short_description: Framework using analogical relationships for understanding.

Metalanguage.short_description: System for describing and analyzing theoretical languages.

Metatheory.short_description: Theory about the nature and structure of theories.

Emergence.short_description: Framework for understanding development of new properties and patterns.
